item.title: Region 10 Pesticide Program and Contacts
item.description:
Report Pesticide Violations

  • Violations of the use of a pesticide The following links exit the site Exit
    • Alaska
    • Idaho
    • Oregon
    • Washington
    • On Federal Property
    • On Tribal Lands
  • Manufacturer or distributor violations (e.g., labeling or production)
    • EPA Environmental Tips and Complaints System

Notice of Arrival of Pesticides and Devices

Submit a complete notice of arrival form to r10noa@epa.gov

Pesticide Producer Establishment Application and Reporting

Submit a complete application for pesticide producer establishment number to r10pesticideestablishments@epa.gov

Submit complete pesticide-producing and device-producing establishment reports to r10pesticideestablishments@epa.gov

Federal Certification to Apply Restricted Use Pesticides in Indian Country

Send a complete application for federal certification to:
Attn: Federal Certification
Pesticides and Toxics Unit (OCE-101)
U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 10
1200 Sixth Ave, Suite 900
Seattle, WA 98101-1128

Questions about federal certification? Email r10cert@epa.gov or call 206-553-4768

Contacts

Name Email Phone Area of Responsibility
Kelly Mcfadden mcfadden.kelly@epa.gov 206-553-1679 Manager of pesticides
Gianpaolo Boccato boccato.gianpaolo@epa.gov, r10noa@epa.gov 206-553-1193 Import/export coordinator, inspector, case officer, bed bugs coordinator, pesticides coordinator for Washington
Gabriela Carvalho carvalho.gabriela@epa.gov 206-553-6698 Water quality coordinator, tribal pesticides coordinator, pesticides coordinator for Alaska, Yakama Nation, and Coeur d’Alene Tribe, pollinator protection coordinator
Linda Liu liu.linda@epa.gov 206-553-1447 Pesticides endangered species protection program coordinator, pesticides coordinator for Oregon
Chad Schulze schulze.chad@epa.gov 206-553-0505 Pesticide enforcement coordinator, section 7 pesticide producers, supplemental distributers, confidential business information officer, container/containment, inspector, case developer
Derrick Terada terada.derrick@epa.gov 206-553-4768 Certification and training coordinator, worker protection standards coordinator, inspector, case developer, pesticides coordinator for Idaho, federal certification plan coordination, oversight for Indian Health Service

U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 10
1200 Sixth Ave, Suite 900
Seattle, WA 98101-1128
800-553-1200 (toll free)
